intro: Minuartia stricta, commonly known as the upright sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has small, needle-like leaves that help it conserve water in harsh, cold environments. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra or mountainous areas. Minuartia stricta is a hardy species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
